networking

Class Server.ServerClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • networking.Client
      • networking.Server.ServerClient
  • Enclosing class:
    Server

    public final class Server.ServerClient
extends Client
    The ServerClient class is the client representation on the server side, a modification of the Client class. It contains the essential features required to represent a client on the server. The data transmission is handled by the NetworkCommunication class, which runs on its own thread.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mohammad Alali
    See Also:
    NetworkCommunication, Client

      • server

        private Server server

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerClient

        public ServerClient(Server server,
                    java.net.Socket socket)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a new client on the server. It is used to represent the client on the server side. Successful creation of a ServerClient instance will trigger the onConnected(String, int) method, otherwise the Client.onFailedToConnect(String, int) method will be triggered.
        Parameters:
        server - - the server the client has connected to
        socket - - the socket of the connected client
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - - thrown when the the parameter server or socket is null.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - - thrown when facing issues creating input and output streams for the socket.
        Since:
        1.0
